name: gnawed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
gnaw
gnaw verb [I + prep, T]
(BITE)
to bite or chew something repeatedly, usually making a hole in it or gradually destroying it: Babies like to gnaw hard objects when they're teething. A dog lay under the table, gnawing on a bone.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to chew foodchewMake sure you chew your food thoroughly.biteShe bit into the apple.nibbleShe nibbled on peanuts while waiting for her dinner to cook.munchHe munched popcorn throughout the whole film.crunchShe was crunching on an apple.chompHe was chomping a chocolate bar.

gnaw verb [I + prep, T]
(FEEL WORRIED)
to make you feel worried or uncomfortable: I've been gnawed by guilt about not replying to her letter yet. The feeling that I've forgotten something has been gnawing at me all day.
